item.title: "Guild of Thieves Remastered" is out!
item.description: I guess this is a sign of how recent life has been all-consumed by work, but I only just noticed that Strand Games have released the second of their Magnetic Scrolls remasters, “The Guild of Thieves”. There are few games which I remember as fondly as this, not just because it is a brilliant adventure (which it certainly is), but because it was the game - and only game - I ordered alongside my beloved Amiga 500.

item.title: Happy Thimbleweed Park Day!
item.description: The iPad has become my preferred platform for playing adventure games, so I’ve been looking forward to this one. I backed the Kickstarter almost three years ago and it’s been a treat to see it take shape - the dev blog posts and podcasts were worth it alone. As luck would have it, my next overseas business trip is coming up in a few days which I hope will provide ample of opportunity to dive into it proper.

item.title: Full Throttle Remastered arrives on iOS
item.description: Finally! I’ve been waiting for this one for a while: “Full Throttle Remastered” has been released for iOS. The iPad has become my adventure gaming device of choice (aside from 8bit text adventures, and I’m trying to figure out a solution for that), so it’s great to see another LucasArts classic on the platform. Not only that, but to coincide with the release Double Fine have slashed the prices of “Grim Fandango Remastered” and “The Day of the Tentacle Remastered” - both highly recommended and absolute bargains at this price.

item.title: Broken Age Part 1
item.description: The Double Fine Adventure Kickstarter was one of those few moments where you feel like you’re actually seeing a seismic shift in the industry. I jumped in within hours of the campaign going live - as a huge fan of adventure games, particularly those from Lucasfilm/Lucas Arts, I didn’t need to think twice. It’s been a really fascinating ride since then - the behind the scenes videos are the best accounts of game development ever committed to film, and I almost don’t want them to finish the game as that will mean the end of them.
